solution_line_template: The total bill before taxes or gratuities was ${steak_price} for the steak + ${wine_price} for the wine = ${steak_price}+${wine_price} = $<<{steak_price}+{wine_price}={pre_tax_total}>>{pre_tax_total}
If the tax is {tax_percent_num}%, then the taxes paid were ${pre_tax_total} * {tax_percent_num}% = $<<{pre_tax_total}*{tax_percent_num}*{percent_factor}={tax_amount}>>{tax_amount}
That means that the total bill before gratuities was ${pre_tax_total} + ${tax_amount} = $<<{pre_tax_total}+{tax_amount}={pre_gratuity_total}>>{pre_gratuity_total}
If the final bill was ${final_bill}, then you were charged ${final_bill}-${pre_gratuity_total} = $<<{final_bill}-{pre_gratuity_total}={gratuity_amount}>>{gratuity_amount} for gratuities
